trans-unit.target: TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_SEQ_00<tab>An unspecified task awaits you.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_TODO_00<tab>Speak with G'raha Tia.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_TODO_01<tab>Survey the designated location and defeat any enemies that appear.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_TODO_02<tab>Survey the designated location again.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Kokkol Dankkol.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_ALPHINAUD_000_000<tab>'Tis strange to hear Father spoken of in such a way...but I suppose he would find your view of me no less odd.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_ALISAIE_000_005<tab>Much as I'd like to press Theopauldin for more revealing tidbits, we should be getting back to our tasks.

TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_010<tab>In the event that our─and I quote─“promised heap of adamantite falls right out of the bloody sky and into my lap,” Master Kokkol wishes to be ready to put the proverbial hammer to anvil at a moment's notice.

TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_011<tab>To fabricate these parts, however, he needs the flames in Kokkol's Forge to burn hotter. He sent me to increase the amount of aether being funneled to his furnaces.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_012<tab>The flow of fire-aspected aether in Labyrinthos is regulated by an elemental reactor south of here─to which I have borrowed the key.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_013<tab>The adjustment will require two people to carry out safely...but I can explain the process when we arrive.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_ALISAIE_000_014<tab>This is where we part, then.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_ALISAIE_000_015<tab>We'll see you in Sharlayan Hamlet once the adamantite arrives, if not before.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_016<tab>This way, then!
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_020<tab>The reactor is housed within this facility.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_021<tab>I'll be the one to go inside and adjust the fire aether output.

TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_022<tab>When I do, a rather large amount of water-aspected aether will issue from the vent at the top. I expect this to attract at least a few elementals─which we would both rather not be drawn into the reactor itself. Trust me.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_023<tab>Can I ask that you put down any that draw too near? They'll pose you little trouble, I'm sure.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_024<tab>Wait here, if you would!
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_POPMESSAGE_000_030<tab>An apa is lured by the siren song of water-aspected aether!
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_POPMESSAGE_000_031<tab>Further creatures have been attracted by the font of aether!
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_040<tab>Did everything go smoothly out here?
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_041<tab>I thought as much. No major complications to speak of inside, either.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_042<tab>...And the water aether appears to be venting properly.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_043<tab>I expect Kokkol will have seen a difference in his forge-flames by the time I return.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_044<tab>Since I have you...there was another matter I thought to discuss with you.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_045<tab>Nothing terribly important─merely something I've been considering.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_046<tab>Part of this, I shared with everyone. Yet you, and only you, have been to Elpis...
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_047<tab>As we have established, refined adamantite is a product of Allag. Of the empire's twilight years, in fact.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_048<tab>It was a material which saw much use as part of the Allagans' efforts to extend beyond the bounds of this world─Dalamud, of course, being the most prominent.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_049<tab>Of those who would push further─expand Allag's empire to encompass the heavens and the stars above─perhaps the greatest was its infamous technologist, Amon.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_Q1_000_050<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_A1_000_051<tab><var 1A 02 /var>Amon<var 1A 01 /var> wanted to travel the sea of stars?
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_A1_000_052<tab>Did he remember his life as Hermes?
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_053<tab>He did. He must have had his own reasons, however, for there is no evidence to suggest that he retained memories of his life as an ancient.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_054<tab>I believe he had his own reasons. There is no evidence to suggest that he retained memories of his former life.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_055<tab>He only joined the Ascians once the empire was all but dust, as you know.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_056<tab>If not his memory, though, what drove him to pursue the idea with such fervor?
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_057<tab>This may seem far-fetched, but what if souls, like minds, have...a personality, so to speak? A natural disposition towards which they are inclined?
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_058<tab>We know with relative certainty that it was the gross decadence and inexorable decline of Allag that moved Amon to resurrect Emperor Xande.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_059<tab>The empire's people spoke lightly of death and destruction, experimenting on those they deemed beneath them to fill the emptiness in their hearts.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_060<tab>In facilitating Xande's return, Amon provided these languid souls with the means to free themselves from the mire of their own indolence.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_061<tab>...Or would have, had not Xande been convinced by his own death that life itself was meaningless.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_062<tab>Amon's desire for his countrymen to conquer the heavens could only be a means to the same end─to instill the people with new purpose.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_063<tab>Like Hermes before him, Amon was appalled by how those around him lived, but could never bring himself to believe that those lives were devoid of meaning.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_064<tab>And both of them sought that meaning, that hope, in the distant stars.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_065<tab>...Such is my theory, anyway.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_066<tab>Ultimately, it is the consequences of their actions which matter. Their motives are of no moment. And yet...
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_067<tab>To reach those stars on wings of adamantite. To travel to the ends of creation and beyond. The promise of hope everlasting...that much I do understand.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_068<tab>But enough musing for now. Why don't we see how Kokkol is getting on?

TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_070<tab>I did thoroughly brief Kokkol on refined adamantite's history. I only volunteered to go to the reactor because I was finished and there was little else to do.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_GRAHATIA_000_071<tab>Hopefully that dispels any misapprehensions that I was kicked out for prattling on...
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_KOKKOLDANKKOL_000_080<tab>Whew! I can feel those flames a-blazin' from here!
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_KOKKOLDANKKOL_000_081<tab>Glad you found someone capable, G'raha, but there's not much left for you lot to do.
TEXT_AKTKMF109_04447_KOKKOLDANKKOL_000_082<tab>'Less you can conjure up that refined adamantite any faster...?
